oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Completeness of rank one perturbations of normal operators with lacunary spectrum
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Baranov, Anton D.
Yakubovich, Dmitry V.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mathematics - Spectral Theory
Mathematics - Functional Analysis
42A65 (primary), 42C30 (secondary)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Suppose $\mathcal{A}$ is a compact normal operator on a Hilbert space $H$ with certain lacunarity condition on the spectrum (which means, in particular, that its eigenvalues go to zero exponentially fast), and let $\mathcal{L}$ be its rank one perturbation. We show that either infinitely many moment equalities hold or the linear span of root vectors of $\mathcal{L}$, corresponding to non-zero eigenvalues, is of finite codimension in $H$. In contrast to classical results, we do not assume that the perturbation is weak.
